reviews.reviewerName: The Cultivated Library CoThe Cultivated Library Co
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Klune does it again!
reviews.reviewText: Wolfsong, book one, is Ox's story. Ravensong continues the series with Gordo's story. Heartsong is all about Robbie Fontaine. To be honest, at first I was like, "Why Robbie???" But Klune showed me why he is the genius writer, and I am the adoring fan.Once again, I have been sucked into the Green Creek world, and I'm so happy to be here. There's so much emotion in Heartsong. Klune has a way of making you feel each and every thing his characters are feeling. With love and loyalty, family and betrayal, the reader falls in love with the Bennett pack over and over again. Klune taps into that basic human need for connection and acceptance. If you're looking for stories that will gut you and heal you, read the Green Creek series.About the book:It's a story about love, brotherhood, family, betrayal, and oh, (if you couldn't tell from the cover), there are wolves.Read this if you like:• LGBTQ+ romance• Fantasy• Werewolves• Books that are both character driven and have some action

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many emotions
reviews.reviewText: Oh this book broke my heart a million times. I’d been looking forward to Robbie and Kelly and their story was gut wrenching. Through it all, they persevered. I love this series, I love this pack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Robbie just wants to belong...
reviews.reviewText: I'm having a love/hate relationship with this series right now...I love it because Joe and Ox, Gordo and Mark, Kelly and Robbie and Carter and the list goes on...I can't describe how much I love these characters and this world, but I seriously hate on it right now because...wow, no fair leaving us hanging here!This story will resonate differently with just about everyone that reads it. It makes you thoughtful, and even now after finishing this installment a week or so ago, I catch myself staring off...appreciating the imagery, in awe of the intricate weave of the story and whole-heartedly agree with the way the author makes you view love and acceptance.I confess, there were a couple of things that didn't quite sit right with me. First, the complete confusion in the beginning that was like a fog that took too long to lift and contradicting events that seemed a bit too convenient, but I chalk it up to this being more of a bridge book to move us into the conclusion coming next summer. I'm not thrilled about the wait, but I'll use it as an excuse to reread the installments I've come to love so much.If you're looking for something different to shake off that book funk, believe me when I say this series will do that!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love I’ve been waiting to read this book. I’ve already read the other 2 and this series is awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can't get enough
reviews.reviewText: I can't get enough of these characters... And I'm sad to know there is only one book left. Obsessed is an understatement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Team Robbie... For the Win!!
reviews.reviewText: Honestly, I was very ambivalent towards Robbie based on the previous two books. I just felt he was just kind of 'there' but not really all that significant... this book changed that for me. I will say, however, that I was not happy with the ending... Carter is my favorite... and the ending was just a big rehash of elements of book 1 and 2; seems history truly was doomed to repeat itself. So much for packpackpack.The beginning of this book wasn't confusing for me as much as it was that I couldn't figure out what time period we were in- was this Robbie's past or present... it was a shock when the truth was revealed.I had previously speculated about what I thought this book would entail, but it appears I completely over-thought the storyline. However, it was also interesting to learn from reading the author's blog, that his understanding of the story changed while writing book two... so it makes me wonder a bit about whether the details in book one are significant to the overall story or not. One example... when Ox was young he heard a growl, he talked to it, and then he saw a 'flash of black' and it was gone. Now, Mark is BROWN... so could this have been another wolf he saw that was at the Bennett house, or was this a slip by the author in saying black and not brown?!? Because if he meant black, then this could mean something big for the ending and truth of the Bennetts.In this book, Robbie finds a book and diary in Maine, the book falls behind the bookcase but he keeps the diary. Later, Elizabeth speculates that Thomas must have left the diary behind when they moved (for some reason Robbie never mentions the book even though there is HUGE significance). Yet, in that book that was lost behind the bookcase, Thomas writes "Ox..Ox...Ox". This would have been BEFORE they moved, so how much did Thomas actually know about Ox before they officially met when Joe found him? OR... did Osmond or Pappas steal it from the Bennett house after they had moved?!? Based on the ending of this book, there seems to be a lot of secrets kept by the previous two Bennett Alphas... and with Robert Livingstone constantly talking about how things were done to him by Abel, perhaps Robert isn't the evil mastermind that we were led to believe... perhaps the truth is, Abel wasn't the benevolent Alpha we all think. It would be nice if, in the end, Robert actually redeems himself. And keep in mind, the title for the next book 'Brothersong' involves Carter and Kelly as well as Gordo and Gavin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I see you ..
reviews.reviewText: Each of these books has hit me a different way. Wolfsong was epic and awesome and tugged at my heart. Ravensong made me laugh despite the angst it made me feel. Heartsong gutted me. Robbie and Kelly’s story was so beautiful and emotional. The way Kelly fought to bring his mate back in his quiet and unassuming way. I loved every page of this book. The audio narration was perfection. I can’t wait to see what happens with the Bennett pack next.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amei demais / Um dos melhores se não, o melhor
reviews.reviewText: Eu simplesmente amo esse casal, amo demaissss ! Esse e primeiro livro competem entre si porque são os melhores da série e são sobre os melhoreis romances ! Eu amei as memórias do Cas com sua família mas eu estava muito ansiosa para o encontro entre os dois acontecesse. Foi incrível como eles se encontraram. O Cas é muito paciente e persistente com o Gavin. O Gavin me surpreendeu, o modo como ele ainda que teimoso, tímido e com medo se manteve firme e confiante e sarcástico com o Cas. A história não me decepcionou em nenhum momento. Foi um livro incrível e um ótimo livro pra finalizar a série.Me bateu tristeza quando acabou porque quero mais sobre este mundo e estes personagens. Eu acho que acima de tudo fiquei triste com o fim pelo fato de querer mais sobre a família. Para mim, além do romance, a interação da família foi um dos fatos que mais contribuirem para amar e me prender em todos os livros.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 20, 2023

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm totally obsessed with this series
reviews.reviewText: This is the 3rd book in the series and the best so far, at least for me.This book is a heartbreaking beautiful story of brotherhood, loyalty and endless unconditional love.Not only between lovers, but also between brothers, family and friends.The book is so unique and so beautifully written. It has so many facets and infinite wisdoms that it is impossible not to think about it.It's not just all the shifters, the amazing werewolves, that make the story so unique and addictive. That's are also the witches and humans that are part of the story, that are part of the pack, that make the experience of what this book is so wonderful.One thing is for sure, I have never read a book like this.I'm in love with all that's this series.I'm currently reading the last book in the series and can't wait to see what the author will put me through ;-)This series is not a standalone series!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing book ! He did it AGAIN !
reviews.reviewText: Holy friggin what ?! I can't even. My reaction to the first 70 pages : Whaaaaa what kind of mind fuckery is that ?! What how When where ? Whhaaaaat ?This book is absolutely NOTHING like what I though it would be and is absolutely PERFECT.I was pissed at it at first, it had been a while since I yelled at a book ! It was frustrating, and sweet, and sad, and hopeful, and once again so filled with found family and love and pack :) The writing is glorious, the bits of humour essentials, the atmosphere all-encompassing, the story fascinating.I can't wait to get my hand on Brothersong. A year is way too long, but I can tell it'll be different too, bringing us in a fourth direction to end this beautiful adventure !
